intro: Reichenheimia thwaitesii, commonly known as the thwaitesii reichenheimia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
